Title: Data Scientist
Description:
GR. SARANTIS S.A. one of the leading Companies in the Fast-Moving Consumer Goods sector with leading brands such as SANITAS, NOXZEMA, STR8, BIOTEN, CARROTEN, ORZENE, CLINEA etc.




We are seeking to recruit for the Data & Analytics Department a passionate and energetic Data Scientist, who enjoys problem solving, and turning complex data into actionable insights. Join us and be part of a forward-thinking team that is dedicated to harnessing data to drive innovation, deliver exceptional results, and make a real impact!




Data Scientist

The role reports to the Head of Data & Analytics




Key Accountabilities:

Understands the decision-making process, workflows, and business and information needs of regional commercial and functional leads and their teams
Translates business needs into analytics/reporting requirements to support executive decisions and workflows with required information
Coordinates with data consumers (functional and commercial leads) to understand their information needs
Design, build, and optimize BI dashboards, reports, and visualizations to provide actionable insights to stakeholders
Manage and configure BI tools (e.g., Power BI) to meet business requirements and ensure efficient performance
Provide ongoing support to business users, offering training on BI tools and data-driven decision-making techniques across different levels of the organization
Interacts with IT application specialists (e.g., S/4Hana) and external application vendors to understand how information is stored, modeled, and tagged
Develops frameworks and processes to analyze structured and unstructured information collected through different platforms and sources
Works closely with global and regional heads and managers for knowledge sharing, mentoring, and training
Acts as a go-to-person for end users to interpret and use information
Stay up to date with the latest data science techniques, tools, and trends, and apply them to improve existing models and processes




Candidate Profile:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
At least 3 years of professional experience in a data analysis or data science role
Minimum 2 years of experience in extended MS Azure services and PowerBI
Proficient in SQL for data querying and in at least one modern programming language (e.g., Python, R) for data analysis, automation, and machine learning tasks
Familiarity with data warehousing techniques and ETL processes
Experience in SAP S4 HANA is a plus
Excellent command of English language




Critical competencies for the role:

Strong analytical, and critical thinking
Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights, providing strategic recommendations to drive business decisions
Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills with emphasis on delivering results under tight deadlines
Problem solving and resourcefulness
Strong communication and influencing skills, ability to cooperate effectively with diverse stakeholders
Flexibility and adaptability







Company Offers:

Competitive remuneration package
Opportunities for career development in a multinational environment
Pleasant and modern working environment in a challenging organization
Continuous learning opportunities
Hybrid working model

If you would like to use your skills and experience in a dynamic and growing multinational company, please send us your CV.

All CV’s will be treated with strict confidentiality.

The company will contact only with candidates that meet the required qualifications and criteria.

Title: Data Scientist/Machine Learning Consultant
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • Strong experience with computer vision and deep learning (CNNs, transformers, object detection, segmentation, etc.);
  • Proficiency in Python and deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or JAX.
  • Experience with image and video processing techniques;
  • Strong knowledge of data preprocessing, augmentation, and feature engineering;
  • Hands-on experience deploying models using Docker, Kubernetes, TensorFlow Serving, or TorchServe;
  • Experience working with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and on-premises infrastructure;
  • Familiarity with distributed computing and big data tools (Spark, Dask, Ray);
  • Understanding of CI/CD pipelines, MLOps best practices, and model monitoring;
  • Ability to work with multimodal data (e.g., sensor fusion, geospatial data) is a plus;
  • Advanced English (minimum B2) for effective communication in global environments;
  • Work authorization in Portugal is mandatory.


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Hybrid work model;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • We don’t have a dress code;
  • We call you by your name and we all address each other informally;
  • Coffee and snacks at your disposal;
  • You will grow in good company. Isn´t that the best way to improve professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase? We are waiting for you!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Internship
Description:
Hey there! 👋

Are you looking for a place to graduate where you can gain hands-on experience in deploying, scaling, and maintaining AI-driven solutions? Do you want to bridge the gap between machine learning and production systems? Then join our team as an ML Engineering intern!

Why? 🤔

At Enjins we want to make Machine Learning solutions that are here to stay. Our mission is to become the go-to ML engineering company in the world of tech scale-ups, for both talent and customers.

How? 🚀

We are driven by impact, and so is our vision on Machine Learning. We don't want a data scientists' laptop to be a graveyard for brilliant models. That's why we created an approach that allows us to actually implement Machine Learning that realises business value. This approach demands our ML engineers to stand out in engineering, data science and consulting skills.

What? [You'll be doing] 👀

We are looking for an intern to strengthen our team in one of two exciting graduation projects. You'll work on innovative AI solutions, focusing on automation, deployment, and optimization of machine learning systems. Your research and implementation will contribute directly to real-world applications, working closely with our AI engineers in a dynamic environment of start- and scaleups.

Your responsibilities:


Design, develop, and optimize AI pipelines for scalable deployment.
Research best practices for monitoring, versioning, and automating AI workflows.
Implement solutions that enhance the efficiency and reliability of AI models in production.
Collaborate with a small team to bring innovative AI solutions to life.



Your graduation project options:


Oddit: We are currently developing an LLM-based application called Oddit that is able to create AI roadmaps and strategies based on inputs such as interviews, data quality scans and code reviews. Basically, we automate our own workflow. Within this project there are plenty GenAI research angles, that will have direct impact on our product (Oddit).
Your AI Engineering Pitch: Bring your own AI engineering topic related to our focus industries ClimateTech, Marketplaces, or Mobility. Whether it's optimizing an AI model performance in Energy, improving real-time data pipelines in a geospatial setting, or enhancing the AI system scalability for a large platform, we encourage you to pitch an AI idea that aligns with our focus industry.


Starting date: 1st of April or May: 4-6 months

Requirements

Who are you?:🚶‍♀️


You're graduating in a Master's Degree in AI, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a similar (technical) field.
You have some experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, or Azure).
You're familiar with Python and have experience with CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and model deployment.
You are pragmatic, proactive, and thrive in small, agile teams.
You are fluent in at least English.
You like to build stuff; preferably you have an ambition to grow your skills in both software as well as AI/ML.



Benefits

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:


A team of talented and ambitious ML engineers.
Insights into real-world AI challenges and deployment strategies.
The possibility of a full-time position as AI engineer at Enjins after your internship.



Have we spiked your interest? 🌎

Let's have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com
Show more

Are you looking for a place to graduate where you can gain hands-on experience in deploying, scaling, and maintaining AI-driven solutions? Do you want to bridge the gap between machine learning and production systems? Then join our team as an ML Engineering intern!

Why? 🤔

At Enjins we want to make Machine Learning solutions that are here to stay. Our mission is to become the go-to ML engineering company in the world of tech scale-ups, for both talent and customers.

How? 🚀

We are driven by impact, and so is our vision on Machine Learning. We don't want a data scientists' laptop to be a graveyard for brilliant models. That's why we created an approach that allows us to actually implement Machine Learning that realises business value. This approach demands our ML engineers to stand out in engineering, data science and consulting skills.

What? [You'll be doing] 👀

We are looking for an intern to strengthen our team in one of two exciting graduation projects. You'll work on innovative AI solutions, focusing on automation, deployment, and optimization of machine learning systems. Your research and implementation will contribute directly to real-world applications, working closely with our AI engineers in a dynamic environment of start- and scaleups.

Your responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and optimize AI pipelines for scalable deployment.
  • Research best practices for monitoring, versioning, and automating AI workflows.
  • Implement solutions that enhance the efficiency and reliability of AI models in production.
  • Collaborate with a small team to bring innovative AI solutions to life.


Your graduation project options:

  • Oddit: We are currently developing an LLM-based application called Oddit that is able to create AI roadmaps and strategies based on inputs such as interviews, data quality scans and code reviews. Basically, we automate our own workflow. Within this project there are plenty GenAI research angles, that will have direct impact on our product (Oddit).
  • Your AI Engineering Pitch: Bring your own AI engineering topic related to our focus industries ClimateTech, Marketplaces, or Mobility. Whether it's optimizing an AI model performance in Energy, improving real-time data pipelines in a geospatial setting, or enhancing the AI system scalability for a large platform, we encourage you to pitch an AI idea that aligns with our focus industry.

Starting date: 1st of April or May: 4-6 months

Requirements

Who are you?:🚶‍♀️

  • You're graduating in a Master's Degree in AI, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a similar (technical) field.
  • You have some experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, or Azure).
  • You're familiar with Python and have experience with CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and model deployment.
  • You are pragmatic, proactive, and thrive in small, agile teams.
  • You are fluent in at least English.
  • You like to build stuff; preferably you have an ambition to grow your skills in both software as well as AI/ML.


Benefits

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:

  • A team of talented and ambitious ML engineers.
  • Insights into real-world AI challenges and deployment strategies.
  • The possibility of a full-time position as AI engineer at Enjins after your internship.


Have we spiked your interest? 🌎

Let's have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Para algunas personas, la tecnología es reto, la innovación es pasión, y la posibilidad de cambiar el mundo es una oportunidad.




Somos una consultora tecnológica que ofrece soluciones globales a las necesidades complejas de las empresas desde otro punto de vista. Escuchamos para crear progreso en nuestro mundo, integrando tecnología y conocimiento.




Desde nuestro área de DATA&IA, buscamos incorporar a un/a Científico de Datos para formar parte del equipo. El objetivo será participar en los diferentes proyectos de IA con el desarrollo de modelos de Machine Learning y soluciones de Inteligencia Artificial. Evaluar la calidad y el significado de los datos. Identificando e interpretando las tendencias y patrones del conjunto de los datos.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?




Exploración y preparación de datos, asegurando su calidad, integridad y representatividad para la construcción de modelos de Machine Learning.
Desarrollo, entrenamiento y optimización de modelos de IA, aplicando técnicas avanzadas de Machine Learning, Deep Learning y modelado estadístico.
Implementación de soluciones de Inteligencia Artificial en entornos productivos, optimizando el rendimiento y escalabilidad de los modelos.
Investigación y aplicación de nuevas técnicas y algoritmos, explorando metodologías innovadoras para la mejora continua de los modelos y soluciones de IA.
Despliegue y automatización de modelos mediante MLOps y herramientas cloud para facilitar su integración en el ecosistema.




¿En qué perfil pensamos?




2 años de experiencia en proyectos de Inteligencia Artificial
Formación en matemáticas, estadística, informática o similar.
Valorable conocimiento de las siguientes herramientas: Microsoft Azure, programación en Python, R y SQL, conocimiento de LLMs.
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo y buenas habilidades comunicativas.







¿Qué podemos aportarte?




Contrato Indefinido. Creemos en el desarrollo a largo plazo de de nuestros empleados, por eso ofrecemos estabilidad laboral desde el primer día.
Flexibilidad horaria y conciliación. Fomentamos un entorno de trabajo flexible para que puedas equilibrar tu vida personal y profesional. Además, tenemos jornada intensiva los viernes y durante los meses de verano.
Plan de carrera individualizado. Diseñamos un plan de desarrollo profesional para que puedas alcanzar tus metas y crecer dentro de la empresa.
Programa de retribución flexible (Plan de pensiones, seguro de salud....).
Formarás parte de un equipo donde el trabajo conjunto y la comunicación abierta son la clave para nuestro éxito compartido.




Si has llegado hasta aquí... ¡Queremos conocerte!

Title: Data Scientist (Junior)
Description:
We are growing our data science team to help Tendam solve challenging problems from the retail fashion industry. We are now seeking a Data Scientist for a unique opportunity of impacting the way the world experiences fashion.

What you will do

Decompose complex data problems and conduct rigorous analysis and evaluations

Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data

Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.

Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets

Present information using data visualization techniques

What we are looking for

Scientific background with computational and analytical skills

Strong problem-solving skills

Programming skills with Python and SQL

Understanding and experience with big data systems, especially with Spark (PySpark)

Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, decision trees, neural networks, etc.)

Experience with data visualization tools and packages

A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

~1 year of industry experience

Extra qualifications

Experience working with huge amounts of data

Experience with cloud based web services (e.g., AWS)

Knowledge and experience with a version control system (e.g. Git).

Why Tendam

One of the largest customer data repositories in industry: more than 20M Club members

Working with multiple different data sources: purchases, marketing campaigns, products, web navigation, apps, etc.

Working with cutting edge technologies and building machine learning models to solve real world problems: have a real impact in the business!

Ability to immediately test the model results in real pilots: quick time to market!

Exposure to agile methodologies

Working with senior Data Scientists to accelerate your professional development

Working in a challenging and dynamic industry




Ubicación oficinas: Madrid Capital zona Norte accesible en transporte público (metro, cercanías-Renfe y autobuses urbanos e interubanos).

Horario jornada flexible: de lunes a jueves entrada entre las 7:30 y las 9:30h y salida entre las 17h y las 19h, viernes jornada intensiva y flexibleentrada entre las 7:30 y las 9:30h y salida entre las 13h y las 15h.

Contrato indefinido.

Salario de fijo + variable

Incorporación inmediata (entendiendo que si la persona seleccionada está actualmente trabajando en otra empresa, tendrá que dar el preaviso correspondiente y se coordinará una fecha entre ambas partes que pueda cuadrar).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ready to find your perfect job fit?

Welcome to HomeBuddy, where making a home awesome is like seeing a vision come to life! We are on a mission to create a friendly and trusted platform to connect homeowners with the right contractors across the US.

What started as a small idea has become a fast-growing home improvement platform focusing on lead quality and long-term partnerships based on trust and mutual success. We are a product-first company with a long-term outlook - our platform consistently and positively evolves based on data insights and the most up-to-date tools.

This job is for you if


You would like to work in a positive atmosphere where teamwork and trust in your colleagues are primary values.
You succeed in an environment that values initiative and sharing feedback and where your suggestions and efforts are recognized and appreciated
You are used to taking responsibility for solving difficult tasks and are directly involved in how your efforts impact the final result



This role is full-time and offers home working flexibility.

Your future tasks will include


Developing and implementing machine learning models to refine lead scoring, identify customer segments, maximize conversions, optimize advertising bids, and prevent churn
Utilize geospatial and socioeconomic data to build predictive models that identify high-value audiences, leaving the competition in our dust
Design and implement pricing & distribution optimization algorithms that maximize lead conversion rates and minimize customer acquisition costs, ensuring we're always in the black
Collaborate seamlessly with marketing, sales, and product teams, translating data-driven insights into actionable campaigns
Present data findings with clarity, conciseness, and a dash of statistical humor, leaving stakeholders nodding in agreement



You're going to need this to be successful in this role


Master's Degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Econometrics, Quantitative Methods or a Related Field
5+ years of experience in the data domain with +2 in data science roles
Expertise in SQL, Python, and Machine Learning frameworks (especially supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms)
Proven experience deploying machine learning models to production environments using tools and frameworks like ML Flow & AWS Sagemaker, ensuring our models are always ready for prime time
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail
Impeccable communication and presentation skills, capable of translating data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth without losing the audience in a sea of jargon
A demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team, ensuring we're always scoring the highest in teamwork
Strong business acumen and the ability to translate data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth, making us a data-driven powerhouse
Fluent English



It's nice if you also have


Up-to-date with the latest data science techniques, whitepapers, and best practices
We value working on Kaggle projects, so if you have a passion for machine learning and are an active Kaggle contributor, please highlight this in your application



Why choose HomeBuddy


Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere without being tied to one place - while ensuring you are available to our team during the agreed working hours
Achieve a harmonious work-life balance with a flexible schedule tailored to your local needs, along with paid vacation, sick leave, and local holidays
Empower yourself with work equipment of your choice partially paid for by HomeBuddy and up-to-date apps and tools to maximize your productivity
Feel valued and appreciated with an industry-leading compensation package
Get recognized and rewarded for both outstanding individual efforts leading to extraordinary results and our team success.
Enhance your well-being with our allowance program covering fitness activities and mental health programs
Learn and expand your knowledge by both working on complex tasks and using paid training opportunities, including courses, events, and conferences



If this sounds like you, we should talk!

Privacy Policy

By sending us your application you agree that Siren Group AG (known as HomeBuddy) will process your personal data to participate in this recruitment process. If you want to know more about how Siren Group AG processes your personal data please click here.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST - AI, Machine Learning & Automation
Description:
Sei un mago dei dati? Ti entusiasma l'idea di addestrare modelli di AI come fossero Pokémon? Allora, abbiamo la missione perfetta per te! 💡✨Perché scegliere INGO?


Perché abbiamo bisogno di cervelli brillanti: la tua visione innovativa e fuori dagli schemi potrebbe essere la chiave per rivoluzionare il nostro modo di lavorare!
Perché facciamo del bene alla biosfera: ci piace innovare con un impatto positivo.
Perché la flessibilità è il nostro mantra: smart working, uffici innovativi e un weekend che dura più di due giorni (sì, hai letto bene!).
Perché siamo ovunque: con diverse sedi in Italia, avrai la possibilità di viaggiare e scoprire tutte le nostre realtà.
Perché qui l’innovazione è di casa: lavoriamo in team e collaboriamo per creare soluzioni che fanno la differenza.



Cosa farai? 👨‍💻🤖Ti unirai al nostro team Automation e lavorerai fianco a fianco con altri data scientist e sviluppatori per:


Analizzare e interpretare dati per scovare nuove opportunità di automazione aziendale.
Sviluppare modelli predittivi e classificatori utilizzando tecniche avanzate di machine learning e AI.
Estrarre insight e pattern nascosti all’interno dei dati per migliorare i nostri servizi.



💡 Vuoi vedere cosa abbiamo già realizzato? Dai un’occhiata ai nostri progetti:


Autoguidovie
AI Reception in ambito healthcare
Virgin Active



Cosa cerchiamo in te? ✅ Laurea in Statistica, Informatica, Ingegneria o un campo simile.

✅ Esperienza nella programmazione, preferibilmente in Python.

✅ Familiarità con tecniche di machine learning e analisi dati.

✅ Conoscenza di metodologie statistiche avanzate.

✅ Inglese B2 (perché l’AI non parla solo italiano!).

✅ Ottime capacità comunicative e di lavoro in team.🚀 Nice to have: esperienza con automazione di processi aziendali. Dove lavorerai?📍 La nostra sede è a Paderno Dugnano (MI), Via I Maggio 13, ma adottiamo una modalità ibrida tra ufficio e smart working.Se pensi di avere la stoffa giusta e credi che l'innovazione, il rispetto e l'autenticità siano la chiave del successo... allora TI VOGLIAMO NEL TEAM! 🚀💥

L'annuncio è rivolto a candidati di entrambi i sessi ai sensi dell'Art. 27 del D.Lgs. 198/2006.

👉 Candidati ora!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
AGILEX, azienda di consulenza informatica, è alla ricerca di:

Data Scientist

La figura sarà inserita per progetti interni o per progetti su commessa da parte dei nostri clienti.

CARATTERISTICHE DEL CANDIDATO:

Sviluppo di modelli di similarità per la classificazione di brevi testi
Esperienza nel ruolo di Data Scientist
Esperienza nello sviluppo e messa in produzione di progetti NLP
Esperienza nello sviluppo in Python
Conoscenza di piattaforme di Cloud Computing
Capacità di scrivere codice robusto e production-oriented, comprensivo di test
Conoscenza base di Kubernetes
Esperienza con l’analisi di testi bancari




COSA OFFRIAMO:

inserimento con contratto d'assunzione: retribuzione e inquadramento saranno commisurati al percorso di studio/lavoro e alle skills dimostrate
Ambiente di lavoro sfidante e collaborativo

Completano il profilo una personalità dinamica e proattiva, buone doti di comunicazione, di pianificazione e organizzazione, ottime doti di problem solving e capacità relazionali e di team working.

L'offerta di lavoro si rivolge ai candidati di ambo i sessi (L. 903/77)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ALTEN Belgium is a leading player in the fields of Engineering, Life Sciences and Information Technology, where people and innovation are at the heart of everything we do. In our open and dynamic organization, we empower our ambitious employees to unlock their full potential and thrive professionally.




We achieve this by offering them exciting projects and continuous development opportunities through the ALTEN Academy and our knowledge-sharing events. Our employees are part of a vast network of expertise, extending even internationally. This way, we foster individual growth while delivering cutting-edge solutions to our clients.




Context

In this role, you’ll help lead innovation in machine-learning techniques for driving and vehicle monitoring. You’ll be responsible for creating a machine-learning model that monitors and analyses time series data in real-time. As part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary team, you'll collaborate with researchers and engineers to integrate and optimize the model. If you’re a collaborative problem-solver with a strong background in time series and deep learning, and you're passionate about motorsport and automotive technology, this is the perfect opportunity for you to make an impact.




Expertise

Expertise in Machine Learning and Deep Learning, including familiarity with classical algorithms
Knowledge of foundation models, including large vision models and multi-modal models
Experience with time series analysis (experience with large real-time data is a plus)
(Preferred) Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and deploying deep neural networks in practical applications
(Preferred) Experience in integrating algorithms and conducting testing in real-world settings (e.g., embedded devices and cloud infrastructure)




Technical

Proficient in Python, with additional knowledge of C++ and MATLAB/Simulink
Strong expertise in PyTorch (experience with PyTorch Forecasting and TensorRT is a plus)
Familiarity with Python libraries such as Pandas and Scikit-learn (experience with SKTime and Darts is a bonus)
Skilled in Linux, Docker, and Git
Experienced in working with Linux environments and High-Performance Computing (HPC), preferably with AWS and Azure
(Optional) Experience with embedded architecture, specifically Nvidia Jetson




Tasks

Design, assess, and refine algorithms from the time series literature
Keep up-to-date with the latest developments in foundation models and time series analysis
Implement algorithms and manage the code repository
Work closely with researchers and engineers to train, test, and evaluate the model
Develop and support demonstrations with real systems and prepare for field tests
Present findings during regular project meetings and prepare results for publication




If you are interested, don't hesitate to apply!




Note: We are only hiring candidates authorized to work in Belgium without needing visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.

By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.

From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.

Job Description

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our growing analytics and AI team. This role will focus on developing Automated Valuation Models (AVM), predictive analytics for urban trends, customer acquisition models, and entity resolution systems.

Responsibilities:



Develop Automated Valuation Models (AVM) for residential and commercial properties using machine learning and statistical modeling.
Conduct data-driven market analysis to assess property trends, demand forecasting, and price fluctuations.
Optimize valuation methodologies using structured and unstructured real estate data.
Design predictive models to analyze urban development trends, economic indicators, and real estate investment opportunities.
Develop customer acquisition models to enhance data-driven marketing strategies and business expansion.
Collaborate with urban planners, real estate analysts, and investment teams to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.
Implement sustainability-focused models to assess the environmental impact of real estate projects.
Integrate climate, energy efficiency, and ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) factors into property valuation frameworks.
Design an entity resolution system to unify and link disparate real estate datasets for improved data quality and analytics.
Work closely with data engineers to ensure robust data pipelines, feature engineering, and data preprocessing workflows.
Manage large-scale datasets from public records, geospatial data, financial reports, and IoT real estate sources.
Work closely with business stakeholders, real estate analysts, and financial teams to align data science initiatives with company objectives.
Present insights, findings, and models to executives and cross-functional teams in an understandable and actionable manner.


Qualifications

Required Qualifications:



Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or predictive analytics.
Proficiency in Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) or R for data analysis and modeling.
Experience with real estate valuation models, predictive analytics, and econometric modeling.
Strong knowledge of SQL, NoSQL, and big data technologies for handling large-scale datasets.
Familiarity with geospatial data analysis (GIS), time-series forecasting, and NLP for text-based property insights.
Experience working with cloud platforms (AWS) and MLOps best practices.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Ability to translate complex data insights into business-friendly recommendations.
Effective communication and stakeholder management skills for collaboration with technical and non-technical teams.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and drive strategic data initiatives.


Additional Information

Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:



Finance:
Competitive salary package, share plan, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
Career Development:
Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
Learning Opportunities:
Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
Work-Life Balance:
Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
Health:
Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
Community:
Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.


Our diversity makes us stronger - it drives meaningful change and enables us to build innovative technology solutions. We are committed to creating an inclusive community where all of us, regardless of background, identity, or personal characteristics, feels valued, respected, and free from discrimination. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all individuals and base hiring decisions on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Data & AI, Data Science Team)
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and we are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to make sure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues, as well as the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!




The team in question is responsible with the development, deployment and monitoring ML/AI models that impact different business areas, such as: Content, Marketplace, Operations, Commercial.

Our role is to provide challenging and suitable projects for data science, infrastructure, data, technologies and to create a safe environment for learning and development. We develop and deploy on-premises and/or on-cloud depending on the project. The trend is towards cloud, development and production, but with yet no deadline. We provide access to Kubernetes cluster with GPU's included, running Docker containers on each task, writing Python and PySpark with internal standards for coding.




What you’ll have to do:




As Machine Learning Engineer in our team, your role is to formulate and argument a hypothesis, to access, clean and aggregate data, train and interpret models, present the result, get feedback and deploy model in production. This implies collaboration with the team members involved in the process, others machine learning engineers, team lead, product owner, analysts, clients and data teams. It is part of our values to help other team members or other teams in the process. It is a non-negotiable value for us.




How we’d like you to be:




In order for you to adapt for the role you need to have appropriate skills for data wrangling with SQL and PySPark, for structured and unstructured data (text), good understanding of ML/AI techniques, such as boosting, transformers and LLM's, on top of strong mathematical and statistical background about mentioned techniques and be able to efficiently write Python code for development and production using versioning control system (Git).

Familiarity with MLOps tools like Kubernetes, Docker, Kubeflow, will make your work and ours a lot easier.




What we’ve prepared for you:




Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Atlas psycho-emotional health platform.
An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
A friendly office. We redesigned our headquarter office to suit our hybrid work model: we doubled the number of meeting rooms and we equipped them with state-of-the-art technology.




Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Show more

Title: Algoritmutveckling / Reglerteknik / Modellbaserad Utveckling Lund
Description:
Combine Control Systems

Combine är en ledande leverantör av högkvalitativa ingenjörstjänster inom reglerteknik, data science och mjukvaruutveckling. Vi arbetar ofta med modellbaserad design med Matlab/Simulink eller utveckling av inbyggda system i C-kod. Det som förenar våra ingenjörer är ett genuint intresse för att lösa problem med en matematisk och teoretisk metod. Vi hjälper våra kunder att få ut sina produkter på marknaden i tid och med hög kvalitet. Vi erbjuder varierande utmaningar i en teknisk miljö, en inspirerande arbetsmiljö och entusiastiska kollegor. Vi har kontor i Göteborg, Lund och Linköping.

Vi söker nu mjukvaruutvecklare inom algoritmutveckling och reglerteknik för att stärka vårt Control Systems Solutions team i Lund. Du kommer att ingå i ett mindre team som ständigt växer och du kommer att vara mycket involverad i att ta kontoret till nästa nivå.

Arbetsbeskrivning

Som konsult på Combine får du möjlighet att arbeta med spännande uppdrag, med avancerade produkter och teknik tillsammans med duktiga kollegor. Våra kunder är några av Sveriges mest framträdande produktbolag med utmaningar i den absoluta tekniska framkanten. Förutom att designa den bästa algoritmen är det viktigt att även säkerställa en effektiv och säker exekvering av koden på det inbyggda systemet. Arbetet fokuserar på funktionsutveckling i Matlab/Simulink eller C/C++ för inbyggda mjukvarusystem. Felsökning och testning ingår också.

Huvuduppgifter


Att arbeta hos kund med algoritmutveckling och implementering i Matlab/Simulink, C/C++ eller PLC system.
Del av interna projektgrupper som levererar lösningar till kunder.


Kvalifikationer


M.Sc. inom teknik med fokus på en eller flera av följande discipliner; Reglerteknik, mekatronik, elektroteknik, datorteknik eller teknisk fysik.
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Modellbaserad utveckling i Matlab/Simulink eller C/C++ kod för inbyggda system.
Flerårig relevant arbetslivserfarenhet.
Du har god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska


Meriterande


Ph.D. inom relevant område
Erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling i Python
Erfarenhet från att arbeta i en kundorienterad roll
Erfarenhet från autonoma system, fordon eller försvar
Machine Learning
Funktionell säkerhet


Egenskaper

Vi tror att du är noggrann, självmotiverad, prestigefull och en bra lagspelare. Du gillar att ha kul och är respektfull. Du har en förmåga att föra ditt arbete framåt, samtidigt som du kan dra nytta av andras kunskap för att utvecklas.

Välkommen med din ansökan!
Show more

Välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: Data Scientist / Developer
Description:
Data Scientist / Developer opportunity with an expanding Data Innovation hub in Dublin City centre. Our Client creates a suite of AI products for large enterprises across a diverse portfolio of sectors. They access a wide source of business data from across the globe, which offers a unique opportunity to design, lab-test and trial scalable business solutions in a reliable and secure environment.




This is a unique opportunity to join a growing business and help build and successfully deliver cutting edge AI products and Data and AI services. Its hybrid working from Dublin City Centre office (2-3 days / week)




Salary guide is 80K + 10% Bonus + 5% pension + Health Insurance




Responsibilities

Join the existing DS team and work on new and existing algorithms
Develop NLP and LLM products following a DevOps approach (Agile, Git, Auto Testing and CI/CD etc)
Collaborate on strategic plans to help define new MLAI applications.




Requirements

Strong experience of python data stack such as (numpy, scipy. sklearn, pandas etc)
Experience across the entire data science lifecycle (requirements gathering, design, implementation, testing and deployment)
Experience of ML and analysis techniques for real world use cases
Experience in data modelling.
Experience in Azure DevOps approach to productionization
Experience working with large datasets

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Specification: Machine Learning & Computer Vision Specialist (12-Month Contract)

Location: Fully Remote (Europe)

Company: My client – AI-Driven Cybersecurity Solutions

Role Type: Contract (12 Months)

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy advanced machine learning models with a focus on Domain Adaptation, Incremental/Continual Learning, Few-Shot Learning, and Semi-Supervised Learning.
Apply ML methodologies to computer vision tasks, ensuring robust performance across diverse datasets.
Develop scalable solutions for real-time video analytics and video processing, including key video frame detection and temporal classification.
Integrate biometric systems, particularly face recognition, into cybersecurity applications.
Optimize models for performance and scalability in resource-constrained environments.

Required Skills & Qualifications

Proven experience in Domain Adaptation, Incremental/Continual Learning, Few-Shot Learning, and Semi-Supervised Learning.
Strong background in applying ML techniques to computer vision tasks.
Expertise in real-time video analytics, video frame detection, and temporal classification.
Proficiency in Python, ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch), and frameworks like OpenCV.
Familiarity with biometric systems (e.g., face recognition) is a plus.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and distributed computing

Title: Lead Data Scientist - Lyon
Description:
Capgemini en quelques mots

Choisir Capgemini, c'est choisir une entreprise où vous serez en mesure de façonner votre carrière selon vos aspirations, où vous serez soutenu et inspiré par une communauté d’experts dans le monde entier, où vous pourrez réécrire votre futur. Rejoignez-nous pour redéfinir les limites de ce qui est possible, contribuer à libérer la valeur de la technologie pour les plus grandes organisations et participez à la construction d’un monde plus durable et inclusif.




Vos missions

En tant que Lead Technique Data Science au sein de la practice Insights & Data, vous serez amener à intervenir sur des projets data pour :




Idéaliser les cas d’usages et cadrer le projet afin de répondre aux exigences métiers à partir de solutions innovantes d’Intelligence Artificielle
Promouvoir les bonnes pratiques au sein de l’équipe avec le développement d’une méthodologie de travail et d’amélioration continue appropriés
Participer aux propositions commerciales sur la partie Data
Construire une relation de confiance avec le client en tant qu’interlocuteur privilégié et assurer la qualité des rendus finaux ainsi que le développement de nouveaux enjeux business
Faire parti des leaders de la communauté Data Science et influencer sur la stratégie Data d’Insights & Data
Continuer de vous former sur tous les aspects de votre métier et assurer une veille technologique sur les innovations les plus pertinentes à mettre en place




Votre profil

De formation Bac + 5 en école d’ingénieur ou équivalent universitaire avec une spécialisation Data Science
A partir de 6 ans d’expériences
Compréhension fine des enjeux business et pilotage d'une équipe
Connaissance de plusieurs langages de programmation (Python, Scala, Spark…) et Cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure, OVH)
Le Machine Learning, le NLP et le Deep Learning n’ont plus de secret pour vous
Bon niveau d'anglais




3 raisons de nous rejoindre

Qualité de vie au travail : accord de télétravail en France et à l’international, accord sur l’égalité

professionnelle, la parentalité, l’équilibre des temps et la mobilité durable. Temps partiel possible !

Apprentissage en continu : certifications et formations en libre accès, accompagnement sur mesure avec votre carreer manager, parcours d’intégration sur 9 mois.

Avantages groupe & CSE : plan actionnariat, activités à tarifs préférentiels, remboursement partiel

vacances, remboursement de votre abonnement sportif ou culturel




Nos engagements et priorités

Le groupe Capgemini encourage une culture inclusive dans un cadre multiculturel et handi-accueillant. En nous rejoignant, vous intégrez un collectif qui valorise la diversité, développe le potentiel de ses talents, s’engage dans des initiatives solidaires avec ses partenaires, et se mobilise pour réduire son impact environnemental sur tous ses sites et auprès de ses clients.




Capgemini est un leader mondial, responsable et multiculturel, regroupant près de 350 000 personnes dans plus de 50 pays. Fort de 55 ans d’expérience, nous sommes un partenaire stratégique des entreprises pour la transformation de leurs activités en tirant profit de toute la puissance de la technologie et des innovations dans les domaines en perpétuelle évolution tels que le cloud, la data, l’Intelligence Artificielle, la connectivité, les logiciels, l’ingénierie digitale ou les plateformes.




Get The Future You Want* | www.capgemini.com/fr-fr

*Capgemini, le futur que vous voulez

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Data Scientist - End User - Hybrid Working


  • Realtà di Prodotto Multinazionale con oltre 3500 risorse è alla ricerca di un Data Scientist
  • Modalità ibrida e flessibile: 3 giorni a settimana da remoto garantiti
  • Sede di lavoro: Provincia di Pavia – necessario essere automuniti
  • Budget: 35K


Nel ruolo di Data Scientist avrai l’opportunità di lavorare in un team specializzato, contribuendo allo sviluppo e alla gestione di modelli e processi che ottimizzano i servizi offerti. Opererai in un ambiente dinamico, utilizzando tecniche avanzate di machine learning e deep learning e seguendo approcci agili all’avanguardia.


Responsabilità

  • Collaborare alla gestione e al miglioramento continuo dei progetti di machine learning in essere;
  • Definire le direttive operative e coordinare il lavoro del team incaricato della preparazione dei dati e della verifica dei modelli;
  • Dialogare con analisti ed esperti di settore per identificare opportunità di innovazione tecnologica;
  • Esaminare dati complessi per individuare schemi, trend e relazioni utili a supportare scelte strategiche;
  • Comunicare i risultati delle analisi in modo chiaro ed efficace, semplificandone la comprensione per gli stakeholder aziendali;
  • Integrare le analisi in strumenti e applicazioni interne;
  • Tenersi aggiornati sulle innovazioni tecnologiche e applicarle efficacemente ai progetti aziendali.


Competenze Tecniche Essenziali

  • Laurea magistrale in discipline tecnico-scientifiche (Ingegneria, Matematica, Informatica, Statistica o equivalenti);
  • Conoscenza approfondita della statistica e del machine learning, in particolare applicati al Natural Language Processing;
  • Familiarità con SQL e con i database relazionali;
  • Padronanza di Python e delle librerie principali per la data science e il machine learning (ad es. pandas, scikit-learn);
  • Conoscenza di GIT e della sua applicazione nello sviluppo software;
  • Buona padronanza della lingua inglese.


Plus (almeno uno):

  • Tesi di laurea su tematiche relative al machine learning o alla data science;
  • Esperienza con modelli di intelligenza artificiale generativa (ad es. prompt engineering, RAG, estrazione di informazioni);
  • Esperienza lavorativa di almeno un anno come data scientist;
  • Esperienza con metodologie agili (ad es. Scrum, XP);
  • Conoscenza di Linux e della shell per operazioni di base (ad es. gestione file, configurazione servizi, SSH);
  • Esperienza con lo sviluppo basato su test (Test Driven Development);
  • Familiarità con la programmazione orientata agli oggetti e con i principi SOLID;
  • Competenze nell’uso di reti neurali e di framework come TensorFlow o PyTorch.


Cosa offriamo

  • Ambiente di lavoro dinamico e informale, con flessibilità oraria.
  • Ore settimanali dedicate alla formazione, con partecipazione a eventi e conferenze.
  • Pacchetto welfare strutturato a sostegno delle esigenze personali e familiari.
  • Sede moderna e sostenibile in provincia di Pavia (a metà tra Pavia e Milano) immersa nel verde, con mensa interna e palestra aziendale.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.

Neotalent, the responsive people.

Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:

We are looking for a Data Scientist to integrate our teams in into one of the largest insurance groups in the world, present in 64 countries. It’s a Hybrid Model.







What you will do:

Modelling business requirements including data streams, integrations (schema API, CRUD API)
Designing and apply reference data architectures in accordance with the requirements of the data management strategy
Designing and apply blueprint for organizational data framework defined how data is obtained, stored, consumed, integrated, and managed in order to enrich the company's DataLakes, MDU and Datamarts;
Defining indicators inherent to DataOps observability;
Ensuring technical functionalities (e.g. scalability, security, performance, data recovery, reliability, etc.).




What you are like:

Experience in metadata management, data catalogs, data standards and master da-ta management best practices;
Knowledge of Machine Learning, algorithms and statistical models (such as classification, time series analysis, regression, …)
Experience in BigData Databases (one or more: BigQuery, Azure Synapse, AWS RedShift, Cassandra, Couchbase, HDFS);
Proven experience in technological implementations – CELONIS will be valued;
Knowledge of data governance and data security practices;
Proficiency in English.




Why join us:

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
… and much more!
Show more

Title: Remote Data Scientist
Description:
Delcoi is looking for an experienced Remote Data Scientist to join their talented team. In this role, you will leverage your data analysis and modeling abilities to drive actionable insights and influence strategic decision-making across various domains. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data science, proficiency in statistical analysis, and experience with machine learning techniques.

To learn more about the company, please visit Delcoi's website:

https://www.delcoi.com/los-angeles/

Key Responsibilities:


Analyze and interpret complex datasets to extract useful insights that inform strategic business decisions
Develop, validate, and implement predictive models and statistical analyses
Collaborate with stakeholders to define data requirements and deliver actionable recommendations based on data findings
Create data visualizations and reports to present results and insights to non-technical audiences
Monitor and maintain the performance of existing data models and implement improvements as necessary
Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science methodologies and technologies to maintain a competitive edge



Requirements


Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or similar role in a quantitative field
Strong knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and data mining techniques
Expertise in programming languages such as Python or R, and experience with data manipulation libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy)
Familiarity with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms
Experience with databases (SQL) and data processing frameworks (Hadoop, Spark) is a plus
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail
Ability to communicate complex technical findings in a clear and actionable manner
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while working in a remote environment
Proficient in English (additional languages are a plus)



Benefits


Assistance with relocation to Madrid, Spain
Annual Bonus
Competitive Salary
Career growth opportunities
Other benefits
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - AI Inteligencia Artificial
Description:
The Digital Business Team develops promising digital solutions for global products and processes. It aims to organize Applus+ Laboratories' information, making it useful, fast, and reliable for both the Applus+ Group and its clients. The team’s mission is to be recognized as the most digital, innovative, and customer-oriented company, reducing digital operations' costs while increasing the value and portfolio of services.




We are looking for a Data Science / AI Engineer to join our Digital team and contribute to the development of evolving data products and applications.




What are we are looking for?

Collect, organize, and analyze information to generate code, train models, verify and validate outputs, and draw meaningful conclusions.
Have strong mathematical fundamentals and be proficient in numerical and statistical methods, as well as a variety of machine learning algorithms.
Bring expertise in NLP and foundation models, with specific knowledge in transformers, tokenization, and encoding-decoding processes.
Apply Explainable AI methodologies and use related Python libraries (e.g., SHAP, LIME).
Demonstrate organized thinking, strong logic and reasoning skills, and effective communication, ensuring knowledge sharing through documentation and well-commented code.
Possess a keen eye for detail to identify anomalies in data and code.
Exhibit creativity and an "out-of-the-box" approach to problem-solving.




Requirements:

Demonstrated experience coding in python specifically working in data science projects and using ML most common libraries.
2+ year experience in ML / AI projects.
Strong knowledge in machine learning / deep learning fundamentals and techniques.
Specific knowledge on Computer Linguistics may be an advantage: NLP libraries like Spacy or NLTK, genAI frameworks such as LangChain and/or LlamaIndex, chunking, tokenization, embeddings...
Specific expertness on foundation models will be considered.
Previous experiences working with Generative AI and explainable AI are welcome.




Our current tech stack is:

Python
Commonly used ML/AI libraries
Azure AI
Java




Technical Requirements

Proven coding experience (e.g., Python; other languages are a plus) in data science projects and familiarity with common ML libraries.
Hands-on experience in ML/AI projects (preferred).
Solid knowledge of data mining, machine learning, and deep learning fundamentals and techniques.
Familiarity with computer linguistics: NLP libraries (e.g., SpaCy, NLTK), generative AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex), tokenization, embeddings, and chunking.
Expertise in foundation models and previous work with Generative AI and Explainable AI is an advantage.

Education

Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
A master’s degree in Data Science or AI Engineering is an advantage.

Languages

Fluent in Spanish and English.




If you are passionate about neural networks, advanced AI algorithms, and challenging yourself, this is the right job for you!

Title: Stanowisko ds. zarządzania obszarem BI i HD-specjalność inżynierii systemów Hurtowni Danych

wielkopolskie


Nazwa stanowiska


Stanowisko ds. zarządzania obszarem BI i HD-specjalność inżynierii systemów Hurtowni Danych


Zadania


Zadania


zapewniać utrzymanie i rozwój architektury biznesowej i technicznej obszaru Hurtowni Danych
odpowiadać za proponowanie, budowanie i wdrażanie rozwiązań z zakresu technologii przetwarzania dużych zbiorów danych (Big Data), m.in. modelowania danych, projektowanie modelów ekstrakcji danych, projektowania i utrzymanie systemów magazynowania danych
odpowiadać za analizowanie wydajności sprzętu i oprogramowania w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
uczestniczyć w planowaniu inicjatyw i projektów mających na celu rozbudowę i optymalizację wykorzystywanych rozwiązań w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
współpracować przy projektowanie procesów ETL (Extract, Transform, Load), ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) w celu pozyskiwania, przetwarzania i ładowania danych z różnych źródeł do systemów klasy Hurtowni Danych
uczestniczyć w pracach projektowych, wdrożeniowych i testowych w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
wspierać użytkowników w ramach wdrożeń systemów i narzędzi w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
uczestniczyć w przygotowaniu planu rozwoju (roadmapy) dla środowiska Business Intelligence i Hurtowni Danych
proponować usprawnienia dla realizowanych procesów i zmiany w dokumentacji

wykształcenie wyższe
doświadczenie zawodowe minimum 1 rok (w pracy związanej z planowaniem, tworzeniem i rozwojem w obszarach Business Intelligence i\lub Hurtowni Danych)
staż pracy ogółem minimum 2 lata

wykształcenie wyższe (matematyka, informatyka, statystyka)
doświadczenie zawodowe minimum 2 lata (w pracy związanej z planowaniem, tworzeniem i rozwojem w obszarach Business Intelligence i\lub Hurtowni Danych)

sprzęt komputerowy,
sprzęt biurowy.


Warunki Wykonywania Pracy


spełniają warunki określone wymogami bhp i ppoż.,
polegają na obsłudze komputera powyżej 4 godzin na dobę,
konieczność poruszania się po całym obiekcie,
konieczność wykonywania pracy poza biurem,
konieczność odbywania podróży służbowych,
budynek 3-piętrowy z windą oraz pomieszczeniami sanitarnymi dostosowanymi do potrzeb osób niepełnosprawnych,
stanowisko pracy zlokalizowane w pomieszczeniach biurowych na 3- piętrze,
miejsce pracy dostosowane do osób poruszających się przy pomocy wózka inwalidzkiego,
wejście do budynku jest zorganizowane z poziomu chodnika,
drzwi przy wejściu do budynku otwierają się automatycznie,
w bezpośrednim sąsiedztwie wejścia do budynku znajdują się miejsca parkingowe dla osób z niepełnosprawnościami

HTML:
• Nazwa jednostki organizacyjnej

ZUS Oddział w Pile

  • Nazwa komórki organizacyjnej

Departament Statystyki i Prognoz Aktuarialnych

  • Miejsce pracy

ZUS Oddział w Pile

  • Adres miejsca pracy

ul. Dr. Drygasa 7, 64-920 Piła

  • Województwo

wielkopolskie

  • Nazwa stanowiska

Stanowisko ds. zarządzania obszarem BI i HD-specjalność inżynierii systemów Hurtowni Danych

  • Zadania

Zadania

  • zapewniać utrzymanie i rozwój architektury biznesowej i technicznej obszaru Hurtowni Danych
  • odpowiadać za proponowanie, budowanie i wdrażanie rozwiązań z zakresu technologii przetwarzania dużych zbiorów danych (Big Data), m.in. modelowania danych, projektowanie modelów ekstrakcji danych, projektowania i utrzymanie systemów magazynowania danych
  • odpowiadać za analizowanie wydajności sprzętu i oprogramowania w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
  • uczestniczyć w planowaniu inicjatyw i projektów mających na celu rozbudowę i optymalizację wykorzystywanych rozwiązań w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
  • współpracować przy projektowanie procesów ETL (Extract, Transform, Load), ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) w celu pozyskiwania, przetwarzania i ładowania danych z różnych źródeł do systemów klasy Hurtowni Danych
  • uczestniczyć w pracach projektowych, wdrożeniowych i testowych w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
  • wspierać użytkowników w ramach wdrożeń systemów i narzędzi w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
  • uczestniczyć w przygotowaniu planu rozwoju (roadmapy) dla środowiska Business Intelligence i Hurtowni Danych
  • proponować usprawnienia dla realizowanych procesów i zmiany w dokumentacji
  • Wymagania

Wymagania Niezbędne

  • wykształcenie wyższe
  • doświadczenie zawodowe minimum 1 rok (w pracy związanej z planowaniem, tworzeniem i rozwojem w obszarach Business Intelligence i\lub Hurtowni Danych)
  • staż pracy ogółem minimum 2 lata

Mile Widziane

  • wykształcenie wyższe (matematyka, informatyka, statystyka)
  • doświadczenie zawodowe minimum 2 lata (w pracy związanej z planowaniem, tworzeniem i rozwojem w obszarach Business Intelligence i\lub Hurtowni Danych)

Wymagania Dodatkowe

  • umiejętność obsługi programów MS Office
  • Znajomość języka SQL
  • orientacja na cel
  • orientacja na jakość
  • komunikacja
  • współpraca
  • elastyczność
  • nastawienie na rozwój
  • negocjowanie i wywieranie wpływu
  • podejmowanie decyzji
  • umiejętność rozwiązywania problemów
  • innowacyjność

Wymagane Dokumenty

  • CV
  • listu motywacyjnego
  • skan dokumentów potwierdzających wykształcenie
  • skan dokumentów potwierdzających wymagane doświadczenie zawodowe
  • skan świadectw pracy dokumentujących wymagany staż pracy lub zaświadczenie o zatrudnieniu zawierające okresy zatrudnienia, w przypadku pozostania w stosunku pracy

Dokumenty należy przesyłać poprzez formularz aplikacyjny 'Aplikuj', znajdujący się na dole oferty

Dodatkowe Informacje

  • proces rekrutacji obejmować będzie rozmowę kwalifikacyjną (przeprowadzoną w formie zdalnej przez komunikator internetowy - wywiad on-line) lub stacjonarnie
  • skontaktujemy się tylko z kandydatami spełniającymi wymagania formalne
  • oferty niekompletne tj. niezawierające skanu, któregokolwiek wymaganego dokumentu nie będą rozpatrywane
  • oferty przesłane po terminie nie będą rozpatrywane
  • miejscem świadczenia pracy będzie Centrala ZUS lub dowolny Oddział ZUS
  • możliwość pracy w trybie stacjonarnym, zdalnym lub hybrydowym
  • Termin, do którego należy składać dokumenty

12-02-2025

  • Oferujemy

Oferujemy

  • stabilne zatrudnienie na podstawie umowy o pracę
  • możliwość rozwoju zawodowego
  • bogaty pakiet świadczeń socjalnych
  • system premiowy

Zakład Ubezpieczeń Społecznych jest pracodawcą przyjaznym osobom z niepełnosprawnościami. Stwarza pracownikom optymalne środowisko pracy, uwzględniając ich potrzeby. Istnieje możliwość dostosowania stanowiska pracy i jego wyposażenia do indywidualnych potrzeb osób z niepełnosprawnościami

Wyposażenie Stanowiska Pracy

  • sprzęt komputerowy,
  • sprzęt biurowy.

Warunki Wykonywania Pracy

  • spełniają warunki określone wymogami bhp i ppoż.,
  • polegają na obsłudze komputera powyżej 4 godzin na dobę,
  • konieczność poruszania się po całym obiekcie,
  • konieczność wykonywania pracy poza biurem,
  • konieczność odbywania podróży służbowych,
  • budynek 3-piętrowy z windą oraz pomieszczeniami sanitarnymi dostosowanymi do potrzeb osób niepełnosprawnych,
  • stanowisko pracy zlokalizowane w pomieszczeniach biurowych na 3- piętrze,
  • miejsce pracy dostosowane do osób poruszających się przy pomocy wózka inwalidzkiego,
  • wejście do budynku jest zorganizowane z poziomu chodnika,
  • drzwi przy wejściu do budynku otwierają się automatycznie,
  • w bezpośrednim sąsiedztwie wejścia do budynku znajdują się miejsca parkingowe dla osób z niepełnosprawnościami

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Descrizione lavoro:

Cassa Depositi e Prestiti ricerca una figura di "Data Scientist"

 

 

AttivitàLa persona verrà inserita nella Direzione “Innovazione, Trasformazione e Operations”, nell’Area “Digital & Technology”, nello specifico nel Team “Data & Intelligence Platforms” e si occuperà delle seguenti attività: (i) definizione, per quanto di competenza,  di linee guida nell’ambito di progetti IT legati all’AI ed al Machine Learning; (ii) supporto, per i profili di competenza, nella gestione di progettualità complesse in ambito AI, dallo sviluppo di modelli predittivi di advanced analytics all’implementazione di use case del mondo GenAI; (iii) governo dell’implementazione di nuovi modelli e maintenance dei modelli esistenti sia on prem che in cloud; (iv) guida di “team” esterni nel corso di progetti ed evolutive in ambito AI e ML; (v) costante aggiornamento sulle ultime tendenze e tecnologie nel campo della AI.

 

RequisitiLa persona ideale possiede una laurea in Ingegneria/Matematica/Fisica/Statistica (costituisce titolo preferenziale la partecipazione a master o corsi avanzati di implementazione pratica in ambito ML/AI) e ha maturato almeno 6 anni di esperienza nel ruolo (di cui almeno 4 in contesti finanziari), sviluppando un’ottima conoscenza dei principali framework di sviluppo in ambito Artificial Intelligence. Il ruolo richiede competenze in materia di framework di sviluppo in ambito Artificial Intelligence (es. LLM, Langchain,), Machine Learning (es. Anaconda, Zeppelin e Jupyter) e linguaggi come Python/PySpark, Julia, Scala. È richiesta, inoltre, la conoscenza dei framework AI dei principali player di soluzioni in cloud (Msft Azure, Google, AWS), dei principali strumenti di Data Visualization (es. Tableau, MS PowerBI, Qlik) e la conoscenza approfondita sulla modellazione dati in ambito Relazionale e Big Data, nonché una buona conoscenza della lingua inglese. Completano il profilo esperienza di team leading in ambito data science, con capacità di motivare e sviluppare i colleghi del team, buona capacità di definire e implementare strategie di data science allineate agli obiettivi aziendali. Saranno considerati elementi di distinzione eccellenti capacità di comunicazione per presentare risultati e raccomandazioni a stakeholder di alto livello e propensione all'innovazione e alla ricerca di soluzioni avanzate per problemi complessi. 

 

SedeRoma/Milano 

 

Deadline candidature: 07/03/2025

 

 

CDP promuove la diversità in tutte le sue forme e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo per tutte le nostre persone. Le candidature ricevute saranno considerate in base al merito individuale e all’aderenza alla posizione ricercata, indipendentemente da nazionalità, origine etnica, genere, orientamento sessuale, stato civile, disabilità, responsabilità genitoriali, età, religione o convinzioni personali.

 

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03 e a persone appartenenti alle categorie protette (L. 68/99).

Show more

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Terna, gestore della rete di trasmissione nazionale (RTN), è impegnata nel processo di transizione ecologica e come regista del sistema elettrico e abilitatore della transizione energetica, ha il compito di sviluppare una rete in grado di gestire una sempre migliore integrazione delle rinnovabili e consentire la progressiva decarbonizzazione del sistema, garantendo al contempo il costante bilanciamento tra energia prodotta e consumata.

Vuoi essere protagonista della transizione energetica e vuoi dare il tuo contributo per la costruzione del sistema energetico di domani?

Terna, è alla ricerca di persone da inserire nel ruolo di Data Scientist, nel team Modelli di Ottimizzazione e Previsione in ambito Tecnologie e Sistemi di Processo, per la sede di Roma.




In qualità di Data Scientist collaborerai alle seguenti attività:




Progettare e sviluppare modelli, analisi ed algoritmi avvalendosi della data science, funzionali ad un approccio Data Driven al governo dei processi aziendali dell’ambito System Operator;
Individuare, sviluppare e manutenere gli use-case, gli algoritmi e i modelli di intelligenza artificiale a supporto delle analisi dei dati per il perseguimento degli obiettivi aziendali nell’ambito del System Operator
Fornire agli stakeholder insights focalizzati sulle attività del System Operator, derivanti dai dati aziendali attraverso l’analisi e l’applicazione di algoritmi e modelli, monitorandone i benefici in un’ottica di miglioramento continuo.




Principali requisiti richiesti:




PHD e/o laurea in Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica, Scienze Statistiche o in un ambito tecnico correlato
Conoscenza ed esperienza maturata nell'ambito di tecniche statistiche di regressione, machine learning supervisionato e non supervisionato, deep learning e data mining, analisi dati, analisi delle serie storiche e loro scomposizione, processi stocastici e sistemi dinamici, metriche di rischio applicate agli investimenti finanziari
Conoscenza ed esperienza maturata nell'ambito di programmazione lineare e/o non lineare mista intera
Conoscenza dell’ambiente Python, RStudio, Stata, SPSS, SAS e MATLAB
Conoscenza dei software di ottimizzazione GUROBI, CPLEX, Fico Express
Csperienza nella gestione di database (SQL, NoSQL) e utilizzo di tecnologie big data (Hadoop, Spark, etc.)
Conoscenza delle piattaforme OpenShift Origin, OpenShift Online e OpenShift Enterprise.
Conoscenza di processi e sistemi del system operator




.

Offriamo un contesto in cui le persone possano in modo efficace collaborare, essere intraprendenti e partecipare alla costruzione di un ambiente di lavoro innovativo e orientato al benessere organizzativo. Siamo impegnati a valorizzare l'unicità di tutti in una comunità di lavoro inclusiva e a prendere in considerazione le candidature con le qualifiche richieste, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro.​ Assicuriamo a tutte le nostre persone un programma di on boarding, sessioni di training mediante Terna Academy e processi di sviluppo per il miglioramento personale.




È possibile candidarsi entro e non oltre il 03 Marzo 2025 cliccando su “Candidati”. Referente per la selezione: Simona Sapio - talentacquisition@terna.it




Ricordiamo che i CV inviati tramite e-mail non verranno presi in considerazione. I candidati considerati in linea con il profilo saranno contattati nelle prossime settimane. Ringraziamo tutti gli altri che hanno inviato la propria candidatura per l’interesse dimostrato verso il nostro Gruppo e confermiamo che la candidatura sarà tenuta in considerazione nel caso di ulteriori future opportunità professionali.

Title: Data Scientist Confirmé - H/F - CDI
Description:
Company Description

Talan est un groupe international de conseil et d’expertises technologiques qui accélère la transformation de ses clients par les leviers de l'innovation, la technologie et la data.

Depuis plus de 20 ans, Talan conseille et accompagne les entreprises et les institutions publiques dans la mise en œuvre de leurs projets de transformation et d'innovation en France et à l'international.

Présent sur cinq continents, dans 20 pays, le Groupe, certifié Great Place To Work, qui compte plus de 7100 collaborateurs et réalise un chiffre d'affaires de 850 millions d'euros à fin 2024, et ambitionne de dépasser la barre du milliard d'euros à horizon 2025.

Doté d'un Centre de recherche et d'innovation, Talan met l'innovation au cœur de son développement et intervient dans les domaines des mutations technologiques telles que l'Intelligence Artificielle, la Data Intelligence, la Blockchain, pour servir la croissance des grands groupes et des ETI dans une démarche engagée et responsable.

En plaçant au cœur de sa stratégie « L’Innovation Positive » le Groupe Talan est convaincu que c’est en étant au service de l’humain que la technologie démultiplie son potentiel pour la société.

Job Description

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un Data Scientist capable de participer à des projets techniques Data Science et IA. Vous devrez faire preuve d’un état d’esprit à la fois innovant, méthodique, orienté solution (et non problème!), et communiquant.

Votre but ultime sera de garantir l’excellence de vos solutions Data Science/IA, pièces maitresses de la réalisation de projets disruptifs pour nos clients.

VOTRE ROLE SUR NOS PROJETS:


En mission: analyse des besoins métiers, définition des principes et méthodes de collecte et de traitement des données, choix des modèles de Machine Learning ou de Deep Learning, mise en application des techniques de traitement et de visualisation de la data, restitution des analyses et résultats obtenus auprès des métiers et des sponsors
Partager techniquement les membres de l’équipe: solutions et code reviews, recommandations, certifications à réaliser, …
Participation à des meet-up, coding dogo,…
Communication: écriture d’articles, retours d’expérience…


VOTRE ROLE CHEZ TALAN :


Benchmark de solutions et conseil auprès de nos clients sur les solutions technologiques à adopter, en lien avec leurs besoins
Réalisation de POC (Proof Of Concept)
Participation à des projets internes et partage de connaissances au sein de nos équipes.
Partage de connaissances et formations interne


#TalanFrance

Qualifications

VOTRE PROFIL:


Issu d’une formation Grande École d’Ingénieur/Doctorant, spécialisée en Data Science ou Intelligence Artificielle
Vous disposez d’au moins 3 années d’expérience dans le domaine
Maitrise des techniques d’analyses statistiques, de modélisations prédictives, de Machine Learning, de Deep Learning,...
Maitrise des techniques de data management et de DataViz
Maitrise de Python, R, RShiny, SQL…
Maitrise de l’utilisation des outils DevOps: Git, Docker, Jenkins/Nexus,…
Bonnes connaissances Big Data: pySpark, Spark, NoSQL…
Connaissance d’outils tels que Dataiku, AWS SageMaker, Azure ML,…
Autonomie, organisation, sens du partage
Excellente communication
Orientation métier


Additional Information

AVANTAGES :


Plan de formation pour accompagner votre carrière (formations éditeurs, certifications) grâce à nos partenariats nous accordant une position de partenaire privilégié, et management de proximité par des experts
Locaux modernes en centre-ville
Top 5 du Palmarès Great Place to Work
Télétravail jusqu’à 5 jours selon les missions, prime d’équipement de 100€
Mobilité en France et à l’étranger
Top 1% des entreprises évaluées par Ecovadis dans le domaine social, environnemental et éthique
Tickets restaurant, prime vacances, 50% transport (abonnement transport public), mutuelle
Permanence handicap (consultant dédié aux collaborateurs en situation de handicap et aux proches aidants)
Actionnariat salarié
Prime de cooptations
RTT


PROCESS RECRUTEMENT:

L’équipe recrutement s’engage à vous proposer un processus de recrutement rapide et fluide


1 entretien RHpar Teams (45min)
1 test technique
1 entretien opérationnel avec le responsable de domaine, au siège (1heure)
1 entretien avec le directeur de pôle, au siège(1heure)
